security: Revealing the names of individuals under non-official cover and their associated files could expose ongoing intelligence operations and compromise the safety of the individuals involved. Quoting directly: “Central Cover Division concurs in your proposal to use the above individual for the purpose indicated... you are specifically requested to advise Central Cover Division/Nonofficial Cover promptly by memorandum when subject has been activated.”
summary: Central Cover Division approves the use of Michell Livingston WERBELL (C-78785) for a proposed purpose and requests notification upon his activation.
summary_one_paragraph: This secret memorandum, dated 24 July 1959, from Joe K. Southard, Chief of the Central Cover Division (CCD/NC), to Chief, WH/Car/PP, with attention to T. Cobb, confirms the CCD's agreement to use Michell Livingston WERBELL (C-78785) for a specified purpose. The memo requests that the WH/Car/PP promptly inform CCD/NC when WERBELL is activated to maintain an accurate register of nonofficial cover activity.
title: Michell Livingston WERBELL - C-78785
